column1:
If
9x
(x-11)(-12x2+133x-16)
 = A(x-11) + Bx+C(-12x2+133x-16)

then find the value of A,B and C
column8:
Rearrange the equation in the form
9x = A(-12x2+133x-16) + Bx(x-11) + C(x-11)
column9: Substitute the value of x such that terms B and C are removed from the equation to get A. Now use this value of A in the equation and substitute a new value of x to derive the value of C.Use the values of A and C in equation 1 to derive the value of B
column10: Based on the above hint , you need to substitute the value of x = 11 to get the value of A . Substitute the value of A in the equation and put x = 0 to get the value of C. Now put the values of A and C in the equation to get the value of B
